Return the type of ViewItem that is located on a specific index in the Layout.
When about to insert a specific cameraId on a ViewLayout, it should be considered to just insert the cameraId on a temporary basis, as no server communication is required for such a change. This can be done if the current ViewItem is already a CameraViewItem, and the change does not have to be permanent. Check the SetCameraInViewCommand message for this operation.

member.summary: Identifying a hotspot ViewItem, no properties used.

member.summary: A Carrousel View Item. No properties used. The Smart Client use will have to configure the content afterwards.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewAndLayoutItem.MatrixBuiltinId
member.summary: A Matrix View Item. No properties used. The Smart Client use will have to configure the content afterwards.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewAndLayoutItem.HTMLBuiltinId
member.summary:
A ViewItem that contains a HTML page. The following properties can be used:
"URL" = the url to be used, e.g. www.google.com
"Scaling" = an integer for how the entire HTML page should be scaled:
"0" = no scaling
"1" = scale until the visible area contains 1280x1024 pixels
"2" = scale until the visible area contains 1024x768 pixels
"3" = scale until the visible area contains 800x600 pixels
"4" = scale until the visible area contains 640x480 pixels
"5" = scale until the visible area contains 320x200 pixels
"HideNavigationBar" = "true" or "false" - to defined if the top line navigation bar should be displayed or not.
"Addscript" = "true" or "false" - to defined if scripting is allowed.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewAndLayoutItem.MapBuiltinId
member.summary:
Identification for a Map ViewItem.
Available properties to set on this ViewItem:
"mapguid" = the id of the map to show. A Guid in string format.
"mapServerId" = Guid.Empty for current MFA site, or the Guid from ServerId.Id of the MFA site that holds the map to be displayed.
The rest are optional, the default values are as follows:
"mapServerId" = Guid.Empty.ToString()
"isInitialized" = "false"
"isZoomAllowed" = "true"
"isAutoMaximize" = "true"
"timeoutSeconds" = "30"
"iconSize" = "0"
"showPreview" = "true"
"showStatus" = "true"
"showStatusDetails" = "true"

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewAndLayoutItem.GisMapBuiltinId
member.summary:
Identification for a Smart Map ViewItem.
Available properties to set on this ViewItem:

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewAndLayoutItem.SystemMonitorBuiltinId
member.summary:
Identification for a System Monitor ViewItem.
Available properties to set on this ViewItem:
"siteId" = the id of the master server on the relevant site. A Guid in string format.
"path" = relative path of Uri to show
"showSiteTree" = show site selection tree for systems with federated architecture

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewItemUserControl
member.summary:
The ViewItemUserControl is instantiated for every position it is created on the current visible view. When a user select another View or ViewLayout, this class will be disposed. No permanent settings can be saved in this class. The Init() method is called when the class is initiated and handle has been created for the UserControl. Please perform resource initialization in this method.
If Message communication is performed, register the MessageReceivers during the Init() method and UnRegister the receivers during the Close() method.
The Close() method can be used to Dispose resources in a controlled manor.
Mouse events not used by this control, should be passed on to the Smart Client by issuing the following methods:
FireClickEvent() for single click
FireDoubleClickEvent() for double click
The single click will be interpreted by the Smart Client as a selection of the item, and the double click will be interpreted to expand the current viewitem to fill the entire View.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewItemUserControl._selected
member.summary: boolean indicating whether the view item is currently selected or not. This status should never be set directly by the content holder, but instead the content holder should request to be selected by using the SelectRequestEvent event.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewItemUserControl._maximized
member.summary: boolean indicating whether the view item is currently maximized or not. This status should never be set directly by the content holder, but instead the content holder should request to be maximized and restored by using the MaximizeRequestEvent and RestoreRequestEvent events.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewItemUserControl._hidden
member.summary: boolean indicating whether the view item is currently hidden or not (e.g. the view item is hidden when another view item is maximized). This status should never be set by the content holder.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Client.PropertiesUserControl
member.summary:
This UserControl contains the visible part of the Property panel during Setup mode.
If no properties is required by this ViewItemPlugin, the GeneratePropertiesUserControl() method on the ViewItemManager can return a value of null.
When changing properties the ViewItemManager should continuously be updated with the changes to ensure correct saving of the changes.
As the user click on different ViewItem, the displayed property UserControl will be disposed, and a new one created for the newly selected ViewItem.

When the class is initiated it will automatically recreate relevant ViewItem configuration saved in the properties collection from earlier. Also, when the ViewLayout is saved the ViewItemManager will supply current configuration to the SmartClient to be saved on the server.
This class is only relevant when executing in the Smart Client.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Client.ViewItemManager.GenerateViewItemWpfUserControl
member.summary:
Generate WPF UserControl containing the actual ViewItem content.
Supported from XProtect Smart Client 2017 R3. If you need your plugin to work with older versions you will have to implement GenerateViewItemUserControl() instead.
If this is not implemented GenerateViewItemUserControl() will be called.

member.summary: Indicate if this item is active in the VMS system, e.g. enabled

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.Id
member.summary: Id

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EventTypeGroupValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the EventTypeGroup property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EventTypeGroup
member.summary: Triggering event group. Defines a group of events in the same area. Valid values are available in the EventTypeGroupValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EventTypeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the EventType property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EventType
member.summary: Triggering event type. Defines the type of event that should trigger an alarm, when received from the source defined.. Valid values are available in the EventTypeValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.SourceList
member.summary: Sources. Defines the source(s) the event is coming from. To define that all sources of a given type will trigger the alarm, use the folder format like: '/CameraFolder'

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EnableRuleValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the EnableRule property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EnableRule
member.summary: Enable rule. Defines when the alarm can be triggered. Options are: Always, by TimeProfile or by events. When TimeProfile is defined the TimeProfile property must contain a valid TimeProfile path, when enabled by events then both EnablingEvents and DisablingEvents must be defined.. Valid values are available in the EnableRuleValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.TimeProfile
member.summary: Time profile. Defines what TimeProfile to be used when checking when the alarm is enabled. Property is only valid when EnableRule is set to TimeProfile.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.EnableEventList
member.summary: Enabling events. When enable rule is 'by events', then this property contains the events that will enable the alarm (but does not create any alarm).

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.DisableEventList
member.summary: Disabling events. When enable rule is 'by events', then this property contains the events that will disable the alarm.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.ManagementTimeoutTime
member.summary: Operator action time limit. If operator action is required within a specific time, the time is defined here. Format is like: HH:mm.ss. Valid values are the same as defined in the Management Client, e.g. 1 minute, 5 minutes etc. Default is 1 minute.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.ManagementTimeoutEventList
member.summary: Operator timeout events triggered. If operator action is required within a specific time, this property defines what event to fire if no action was taken within the time specified in the ManagementTimeoutTime property.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.RelatedCameraList
member.summary: Related cameras. The list of additional cameras to associate with the alarm. The list is a comma separated set of Paths.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.RelatedMapValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the RelatedMap property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.RelatedMap
member.summary: Related map. Defines what map to show in the alarm manager, when alarm is selected.. Valid values are available in the RelatedMapValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.Owner
member.summary: Owner. Defines the initial owner. Should be formatted as Identity.ToString() does, like 'John Doe (Acme/JD)'

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.PriorityValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the Priority property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.Priority
member.summary: Priority. Sets the priority. Can be High, Medium, Low. Valid values are available in the PriorityValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.CategoryValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the Category property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.Category
member.summary: Alarm category. Sets the category of the alarm. Valid options are defined in the Management Client.. Valid values are available in the CategoryValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.TriggerEventlist
member.summary: Events triggered by alarm. Defines a list of events to trigger when alarm is created. List is a comma separated set of Paths.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AlarmDefinition.AutoClose
member.summary: Auto-close alarm: Motion Stopped. Defines if an alarm should be closed automatically upon reception of a specific message from save source.

member.summary: Recurrence pattern on weeks/months. Sets the recurrence pattern to daily, weekly or monthly.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencyInterval
member.summary: Recurrence pattern on days. Defines the ‘Recurrence pattern on days’, which determines how often the archiving is scheduled to run. This property is always interpreted relative to the value of the ‘Recurrence pattern’ property.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencyRelativeIntervalValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the FrequencyRelativeInterval property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencyRelativeInterval
member.summary: Recurrence pattern on relative weekday. Defines the ordinal value of a day relative to the first day of the month, such as first, second or last.. Valid values are available in the FrequencyRelativeIntervalValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencySubDayTypeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the FrequencySubDayType property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencySubDayType
member.summary: Daily recurrence range type. Defines how often the archiving reoccurs on the same day.. Valid values are available in the FrequencySubDayTypeValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.FrequencySubDayInterval
member.summary: Hourly recurrence range type. Defines the interval between scheduled archiving that run during the day.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.ActiveStartTimeOfDay
member.summary: Recurrence range start time. Defines the time when the archiving schedule starts for the day in seconds. The value have to be between 0 and 86399.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ArchiveScheduleChildItem.ActiveEndTimeOfDay
member.summary: Recurrence range end time. Defines the time when the archiving schedule ends for the day in seconds. The value have to be between 0 and 86399.

Contains collection of collections. Each of the latter should be a collection of strings, that contains the registration number as the first element, and custom fields data for this registration number in the corresponding order in the next elements.
If an existing registration number is provided, the info for it is being changed.
If a new registration number is provided, it's added to the database

member.summary:

Use this instead of method, because it will escape and join the strings automatically
member.param: The collection of registration numbers to delete

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MIPKind.SecurityAction

The SecurityAction contains a comma seperated list of ActionId's (DisplayName will come from the plugin when running in the Management Client)
If security is not to be used, this field should be set to String.Empty. Note that when used, the 'GENERIC_READ' and 'GENERIC_WRITE' actionId's should always be available.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.Enabled
member.summary: Indicate if this item is active in the VMS system, e.g. enabled

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.Id
member.summary: Id

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.ManualSensitivityEnabled
member.summary: Enable manual motion sensitivity. Disable to let the system dynamically calculate the optimal level

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.ManualSensitivity
member.summary: Motion detection sensitivity. Specify the minimum change required before counting as motion. Value in range 0 - 765

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.Threshold
member.summary: Motion detection threshold. Specify the level of motion required for an event. Value in range 0 - 10000

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.KeyframesOnly
member.summary: Enable motion detection on keyframes only. Optimize the performance on MPEG-4/H.264/H.265 by detecting motion on keyframes only

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.ProcessTimeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the ProcessTime property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.ProcessTime
member.summary: Motion detection check interval. Interval for how often to check for motion. Valid values are available in the ProcessTimeValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.DetectionMethodValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the DetectionMethod property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.DetectionMethod
member.summary: Motion detection method. Optimize motion detection by analyzing only a percentage of the image.. Valid values are available in the DetectionMethodValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.GenerateMotionMetadata
member.summary: Generate motion metadata. Generate motion metadata for smart search function

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.UseExcludeRegions
member.summary: Use exclude regions. Enable exclude regions in the motion detection

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.GridSizeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the GridSize property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.GridSize
member.summary: Grid size. The grid divides the image into selectable regions. If None is selected, exclude regions are disabled.. Valid values are available in the GridSizeValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.ExcludeRegions
member.summary: Exclude regions. Disable motion detection in specific regions. If you use an 8x8 grid, the string should have a length of 64. If you specify 0 or 1, regions are included or excluded respectively from top left region and going left to right.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.HardwareAccelerationModeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the HardwareAccelerationMode property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.MotionDetection.HardwareAccelerationMode
member.summary: Hardware acceleration mode. Defines if the motion detection resolution uses automatic or no hardware acceleration.. Valid values are available in the HardwareAccelerationModeValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternDaysOfWeek
member.summary: Days of the week as bitmask. Bitmask for what days to include. Bit 0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday etc. Value of 127 (hexadecimal 7f) indicates all days of the week.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternDayOfMonth
member.summary: Date in the month. Used when frequency is Monthly or Yearly

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternMonthOfYear
member.summary: Month. Used when Frequency is Yearly

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternOccurrenceOfDayInMonthValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the RecurrencePatternOccurrenceOfDayInMonth property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternOccurrenceOfDayInMonth
member.summary:
Week number within the month. Defines the day of the week within the month for which the occurrence takes place. For example if bitmask defines 4 = Tuesdays, and this field is Second then the result is the second time it is a Tuesday in each month.
Used when Frequency is Monthly or Yearly, and Define occurrences is Calculated.
Possible values:
None
First
Second
Third
Fourth
Last. Valid values are available in the RecurrencePatternOccurrenceOfDayInMonthValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternTypeValues
member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the RecurrencePatternType property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrencePatternType
member.summary: Define occurrences. Setting Define occurrences to Explicit will use the specific relevant values, for example Date in the month repeated each month - while setting Define occurrences to Calculated will calculate what the date should be, based on Days of the week as bitmask and Week number within the month, for example second Tuesday in each month.. Valid values are available in the RecurrencePatternTypeValues property dictionary.

member.summary: Start of occurrences

member.summary: End of occurrences

member.summary: A list of valid names/values for the RecurrenceRangeLimit property

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrenceRangeLimit
member.summary: End of occurrences is defined by:. Valid values are available in the RecurrenceRangeLimitValues property dictionary.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.AddRecurringAppointmentServerTask.RecurrenceRangeMaxOccurrences
member.summary: End of occurrences by count

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.ConfigurationItems.ValueTypeInformation.Name
member.summary:
The name of the value type detail.
For validation of Int, it can be "MaxValue" or "MinValue" and the Value will contain that value.
For help to Enum, the Name is the default displayname for en-US, the TranslationId is used for other languages.
For sliders, it can be "MinValue", "MaxValue" and "StepValue".
The ValueTypeInfoNames class contains these constants.

GenericTranscodedVideoSource - generic class to dela with transoded sources
This class is NOT thread safe, and all calls to these methods MUST be coming from same thread.
When getting images from the server, it should be considered that the Get() method can take some time and is not ideal to execute on a UI thread.

member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the with and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericTranscodedVideoSource`1.SuspendSettingsUpdate
member.summary: Calling this method will suspend the change to any settings, until a ResumeSettingsUpdate has been called.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericTranscodedVideoSource`1.ResumeSettingsUpdate
member.summary: Calling this method will allow the system to perform the pending settings changes done between calling the SuspendSettingUpdate and this method.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericTranscodedVideoSource`1.SetWidthHeight
member.summary: Enforce the changed width, height and allow upscaling properties.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericTranscodedVideoSource`1.SetCropRectangle(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Define a cropping rectangle of what part of the image to pick out.
The values are all between 0.0 up to 1.0 as a relative part of the original image.
To crop out a lower right hand rectangle these values could apply:
SetCropRectangle( 0.5, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25 );

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericTranscodedVideoSource`1.Compression
member.summary:
The quality of the JPEGs. A value between 1..100.
The name of the property should really have been Quality, not Compression.
The default value is 75.

member.summary: Can be set to any value or class that is used by the application. The current value will be 'returned' in any subsequent JPEGData on next received frame.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericVideoSource`1.GetNearest(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the nearest raw image to the DateTime specified.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericVideoSource`1.GetAtOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the previous image to the DateTime specified or the image at the exact same time.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericVideoSource`1.GoToWithResult(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.remarks:
This method will return true if the video pointer was moved - even if the time it was moved to is far in time from the requested time. False is only returned if the video pointer is not moved, which only happens in a few cases:
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Forward, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or after the requested time. Only if the requested time is after database end will GoToWithResultreturn false.
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Reverse, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or before the requested time. Only if the requested time is before database start will GoToWithResult return false.
If the direction argument is something else, it will return true, if there is any video and false only if the DB is empty.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the PlaybackPlayModeData definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.
member.returns: True if the video pointer was moved; false if it did not move

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.GenericVideoSource`1.GoTo(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the PlaybackPlayModeData definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.

member.summary: For internal use only. Instantiate the VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter() class.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.Init
member.summary: Initialize managed wrapper. Only needed in Standalone, must be called before using any instance of WAVExporter

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.Close
member.summary: Uninitialize managed wrapper. Only needed in Standalone, should be called when done using any instance of WAVExporter, for example at exit.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.AudioList
member.summary: The list of Audio sources to export. Can be microphones, Speakers.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.Path
member.summary:
Where to store the export on hard disk.
Used when the ExportToDisk is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.ExportToDisk
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export hard disk.
The path of where to store the export is defined in the Path property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins.
Default value is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.ExportToMediaBurner
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export to an optical disc (i.e. DVD).
The drive letter of where to burn the export is defined in the MediaBurnerDriverLetter property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.MediaBurnerDriverLetter
member.summary:
When the ExportToMediaBurner is set to true, the MediaBurnerDriverLetter is used to identify which burner to use.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
There is no default value, must be specified for MediaBurner exports.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IWAVExporter.ExportName
member.summary:
Specify the name of the export. This value is used as the name of the subdirectory under the path and as the name of the optical disc.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is a construction of current Date and Time

member.summary: Audio bit per sample. Default is 16 bits

The end time.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGData.HardwareDecodingStatus
member.summary:
Defines how the decoding of the current frame is performed.
Values can be:
'hardware' - Decoded by GPU
'software' - Decoded by Intel Media SDK
'fallback' - Decoded by Intel Media SDK, even though it was requested to be Hardware (or Auto)
'ipp' - Decoded by Intel UMC

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSourceImplementer
member.summary:
JPEGVideoSourceImplementer gets recorded video image formatted as JPEGs.
This class is NOT thread safe, and all calls to these methods MUST be coming from same thread.
When getting images from the server, it should be considered that the Get() method can take some time and is not ideal to execute on a UI thread.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSourceImplementer.#ctor(VideoOS.Platform.Item)
member.summary: Construct a VideoSource for JPEG handling. The Item MUST be of Kind==Kind.Camera

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSourceImplementer.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the with and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataSupplier
member.summary:
This class automatically provides metadata when available, both in live and playback.
In standalone you must initialize the Export and Media environments prior to using this class.
Usage: Provide the metadata source in the constructor, subscribe to and call .
Call when done.

member.summary: Constructor for metadata source that will follow the main windowstate.
member.param: The metadata source from which to receive data

member.summary: Constructor for following state of specific window.
member.param: The metadata source from which to receive data
Information about the window this control is used in and thus what controls the data flow. Only for Smart Client - always use the constructor without this parameter in standalone.

member.summary: Call this method to start listening for metadata.
member.returns: True on success

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataSupplier.Stop
member.summary: Call this method to stop listening for metadata.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataSupplier.NewMetadataEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to receive metadata.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataSupplier.ErrorEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to be notified when errors occurs.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataSupplier.MetadataInvalidatedEvent
member.summary:
Subscribe to this event to be notified when the recent metadata becomes invalid.
In live mode, the event is raised when the recent metadata valid time expires.
In Playback mode, the event is raised when playback control browses/plays before the metadata time, or browses/plays after the metadata expired time.
When changing between mode, the event is raised on a recent valid metadata if there's one.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter
member.summary: This class will use environment specific implementation to export one or mixture of multiple audio streams to an WAV file. You can do sound mixing with combination of speaker output and microphone input for instance. To export multiple audio streams, you need to set the property then call the method.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.#ctor
member.summary: Exports the currently defined device(s) in WAV data format

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Init
member.summary: Initialize managed wrapper. Only needed in Standalone, must be called before using any instance of WAVExporter

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Close
member.summary: Uninitialize managed wrapper. Only needed in Standalone, should be called when done using any instance of WAVExporter, for example at exit.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.AudioList
member.summary: The list of Audio sources to export. Can be microphones, Speakers.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Path
member.summary: Where to store the export on hard disk.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.ExportToDisk
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export hard disk.
The path of where to store the export is defined in the Path property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins.
Default value is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.ExportToMediaBurner
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export to an optical disc (i.e. DVD).
The drive letter of where to burn the export is defined in the MediaBurnerDriverLetter property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.MediaBurnerDriverLetter
member.summary:
When the ExportToMediaBurner is set to true, the MediaBurnerDriverLetter is used to identify which burner to use.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
There is no default value, must be specified for MediaBurner exports.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.ExportName
member.summary:
Specific the name of the export. This value is used as a part of the path and a the name of the optical disc.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is a construction of current Date and Time

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.FileName
member.summary: Name of the WAV file.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Codec
member.summary: Codec to be used for WAV

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.CodecList
member.summary: Returns a list of valid codecs to be used for the WAV export

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Channels
member.summary: Number of audio channels

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.AudioSampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate for Audio. Default is 8000

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.AudioSampleDepth
member.summary: Audio bit per sample, default is 16 bits

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.StartExport(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Exports the currently defined devices as an WAV file. Returns error if already in progress.
member.param: The start time.
The end time.
member.returns: True if export was started. Is finished when Progress >= 100.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.WAVExporter.Progress
member.summary: Gets the updated progress in percent
member.value: The percent done. Out of range 0-100 means error. -2 means uninitialized.

member.summary: Cancels the current export operation

member.summary: A custom tag set by the user to filter the events.

member.summary: The source of the event. This can represent e.g. a camera, a microphone, a user-defined event, etc.

member.summary: The expire time of the event. The event will be deleted from the event database when the time is reached. When creating events a value of DateTime.MinValue (default value) indicates that the default event expire time should be used.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.EventHeader.MessageId
member.summary: The message id of the event. The message id coorsponds to the ID part returned in ItemManager.GetKnownEventTypes

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.EventSource
member.summary: The source of the event. This can represent e.g. a camera, a microphone, a user-defined event, etc.

members.member:
The name of the source.
When used for sending an AnalyticsEvent, the Name can be filled with an IP address and the Event Server will convert this to the correct FQID - do not fill the FQID in this case.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.EventSource.Description
member.summary: A description of the source.

members.member:
The Fully Qualified ID of the source.
When sending AnalyticsEvent to the EventServer, this field can be ignore when the Name field contains an IP address of the source (e.g. the camera that provided the video the analytics is done on).

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache
member.summary:
This class is repsonsible for caching and navigating a pseudo-"GOP" of metadata content. It handles navigating retreiving, storing and navigating by supporing and operations.
This class is not thread-safe!

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache._data
member.summary: Contains the latest recieved data which is cached. This class depends on this list to be sorted according to the dates of content in ascending order!

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.FirstEntry
member.summary: Gets the first element in the cache. Returns null if the cache is empty.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.LastEntry
member.summary: Gets the last element in the cache. Returns null if the cache is empty.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.SetCacheContents(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataPlaybackData})
member.summary: Load new data into the cache and reset the state used to compute next and previous elements.
member.param: The data to load into the cache.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.FindCacheEntryAfter(System.DateTime)
member.summary: This method finds the first element in the sequence that has a later date than . If is before the first entry in the cache or after the last entry, the cache is viewed as invalid as there may be data between the first entry and the requested entry.
member.param: The timestamp to find the next entry after
member.returns: The first element with a timestamp later than or null if such an element does not exist

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.FindCacheEntryBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: This method finds the last element in the sequence that has a date earlier than . If is before the first entry in the cache or after the last entry, the cache is viewed as invalid as there may be data between the first entry and the requested entry.
member.param: The timestamp to find the next entry before
member.returns: The first element with a timestamp earlier than or null if such an element does not exist

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.GetNext
member.summary: Gets the element after the last returned element. This method will return null if it does not make sense to talk of a next element. This happens when data was just loaded (there is no previously returned element), if the element returned was the last in the cache or if a previous call returned null.
member.returns: The element after the last returned element or null, if it either does not exist or cannot be determined

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.GetPrevious
member.summary: Gets the element before the last returned element. This method will return null if it does not make sense to talk of a previous element. This happens when data was just loaded (there is no previously returned element) or if the element returned was the first in the cache.
member.returns: The element before the last returned element or null, if it either does not exist or cannot be determined

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.GetNearest(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the element in the cache that is closest to the timestamp. If the timestmap is before the first element or after the last, null will be returned.
member.param: The timestamp to search for
member.returns: The closest element or null if the timestamp is outside the cache

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.GetAtOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the last element in the cache that is smaller than or equal to the timestamp given. If the timestmap is before the first element or after the last, null will be returned.
member.param: The timestamp that the element returned must be equal to or smaller
member.returns: An element matching the query or null if nothing could be found.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataCache.Clear
member.summary: Clears the cache of all contents.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.HardwareDefinition.GenerateParameters
member.summary:
Generates an of all the parameters describing the hardware configuration. These parameters are in the format used by the MIP driver. There is usually no need to call this method in client code, but it does give the option of manipulating the parameters by hand.
The resulting dictionary is used to transmit to the MIP Driver.

member.summary:
Generates an of all the parameters describing the hardware configuration. These parameters are in the format used by the MIP driver. There is usually no need to call this method in client code, but it does give the option of manipulating the parameters by hand.
The resulting dictionary is used to transmit to the MIP Driver.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataTypeDefinition
member.summary: This class is responsible for handling the parameters that define the type of metadata a metadata device delivers when using the MIP driver. The display name (or its translation) will be used as the headline on the settings tab for the device in the Management Client. All capabilities in this type will then appear as children in the setting tab.

member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the type definition. This name is considered a pair with the . If there is no standard name for the type yet, any name can be used as it is not shown to the user.
member.remarks: The name usually has the format of all-capital letters and underscores for space. Examples of this format are "META_DATA_GPS" and "META_DATA_BOUNDING_BOX".

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataTypeDefinition.Id

member.summary:
The virtual channel number this stream is identified by.

Contains the set of parameters this application can return to the VMS system, when requested.
These parameters are displayed in the administrators UI.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataProviderChannel.ServerParameterDictionary
member.summary:
Contains the set of parameters the server has set.

member.summary: Give the status of the current TCP session.

member.summary: This method will disconnect the session.

member.summary: Enqueue a single piece of metadata to transmit.

This parameter currently has no effect and should just be set to DateTime.UtcNow
This parameter has no effect and should not be used.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataProviderChannel.SessionOpening
member.summary: Called when a new session is being opened from the VMS system. The parameter contains information about the specific parameters requested for this session. For the parameters not requested in this session, the default parameters on the MetadataProviderChannel should be used.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataProviderChannel.SessionClosed
member.summary: Called when one session on this channel is closed from the VMS.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataProviderChannel.ParametersChanged
member.summary:
Event is fired when the administrator has changed the configuration.
The receiving application should pass the ServerParameterDictionary and update the ParameterDictionary if the asked changes are valid. Also, the current values should be stored on disk, so any restart of the application will know what the latest configuration is.

MetadataPlaybackSource gets metadata in raw mode. This means that the Generic Byte Header as well as the content is available.
When getting metadata from the server, it should be considered that the Get() method can take some time and is not ideal to execute on a UI thread.

member.summary: Get the nearest raw metadata to the specified. This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.
member.param: A specifying when to look for data
member.returns: null or an instance of with the recorded data

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataPlaybackSource.GetAtOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Get the previous image or the image at the exact same time as specified by . This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.
member.returns: null or an instance of with the recorded data

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataPlaybackSource.GoToWithResult(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.remarks:
This method will return true if the video pointer was moved - even if the time it was moved to is far in time from the requested time. False is only returned if the video pointer is not moved, which only happens in a few cases:
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Forward, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or after the requested time. Only if the requested time is after database end will GoToWithResultreturn false.
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Reverse, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or before the requested time. Only if the requested time is before database start will GoToWithResult return false.
If the direction argument is something else, it will return true, if there is any video and false only if the DB is empty.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.
member.returns: True if the video pointer was moved; false if it did not move

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MetadataPlaybackSource.GoTo(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.AVIExporter
member.summary:
This class will use environment specific implementation to export either one video stream with zero or more audio streams, or multiple video streams, to an AVI file.
To export just a single video stream (optionally with one or more audio streams) use the and properties and then call the method.
To export multiple video streams sequentially to the same AVI file use the method and specify the cameras to export in the argument to this method. Audio is not supported for sequential export.
Sequential export in the Smart Client is supported from 2017 R3.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.AVIExporter.AutoSplitExportFile
member.summary:
Enable/disable the autoSplitExport feature. Default set to true (=enable splitting).
When this property is set to true, the resulting AVI file is split into AVI files of with size as set in the MaxAVIFileSize property.
When this property is set to false, the resulting AVI file is limited to a size of MaxAVIFileSize. If the file size is exceeded then the export fails.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.AVIExporter.MaxAVIFileSize
member.summary:
Set the max file size of the autoSplitExport feature.
Default value is 512 MB, e.g. value of 512*1024*1024.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.AVIExporter.SetOverlayImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies an overlay image to the exported video. The positioning and size are relative to the zoomed/cropped exported image (video). The method must be called prior to StartExport. For platform integrations this feature is only supported in combination with method.
member.param: The overlay image to be used. Should be in an alpha-enabled image color format (RGBA or BGRA) to be able to handle (semi-)transparent areas. Any other format will not support transparency.
The vertical position of the overlay image relative to the regular orientation of the output images, supports: Top, Centered and Bottom location - use defined constants.
The horizontal position of the overlay image relative to the regular orientation of the output images, supports: Left, Centered and Right - use defined constants.

Scale factor relative the output image size. The value of 1.0 indicates 100% size, and smaller means that the overlay will cover a smaller area of the image. Larger values will result in that the surplus will be cropped.
Flag indicating whether or not the aspect ratio is taken into account. The value of false will ensure aspect ratio correction, otherwise the overlaying is done directly on a pixel-to-pixel basis.
member.returns: True if successfully set the overlay image, otherwise false.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSourceImplementer
member.summary:
BitmapVideoSourceImplementer gets video image formatted as Bitmaps.
This class is NOT thread safe, and all calls to these methods MUST be coming from same thread. When getting images from the server, it should be considered that the Get() method can take some time and is not ideal to execute on a UI thread.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSourceImplementer.#ctor(VideoOS.Platform.Item)
member.summary: Construct a VideoSource for Bitmap handling. The Item MUST be of Kind==Kind.Camera

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSourceImplementer.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the with and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
The Bitmap format will be set to BGR24.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSourceImplementer.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32,VideoOS.Platform.BitmapFormat)
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the with and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
The Bitmap format will be set to the specified format.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.
member.param: The width of the video frames to be received, or 0 for original size
The height of the video frames to be received, or 0 for original size
The format of the bitmap.

BitmapVideoSource gets video image formatted as Bitmaps.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.Init
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set default width and height.
Default is currently VGA, e.g. 640x480. It it not the camera defined resolution!
The Bitmap format will be set to BGR24.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the width and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
The Bitmap format will be set to BGR24.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.Init(System.Int32,System.Int32,VideoOS.Platform.BitmapFormat)
member.summary:
Initialize the server connection and set the width and height to specific values.
The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.
The Bitmap format will be set to the specified format.
member.exception: Looks like a programming error, check order and parameters of the calls.
Unable to connect to the server. Could be user is not authorized to see this camera.
member.param: The width of the video frames to be received, or 0 for original size
The height of the video frames to be received, or 0 for original size
The format of the bitmap.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.GetNearest(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the nearest bitmap to the DateTime specified.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.GetAtOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the nearest bitmap to the DateTime specified.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.GoToWithResult(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.remarks:
This method will return true if the video pointer was moved - even if the time it was moved to is far in time from the requested time. False is only returned if the video pointer is not moved, which only happens in a few cases:
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Forward, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or after the requested time. Only if the requested time is after database end will GoToWithResultreturn false.
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Reverse, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or before the requested time. Only if the requested time is before database start will GoToWithResult return false.
If the direction argument is something else, it will return true, if there is any video and false only if the DB is empty.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the PlaybackPlayModeData definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.
member.returns: True if the video pointer was moved; false if it did not move

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BitmapVideoSource.GoTo(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available. Set to one of the PlaybackPlayModeData definitions, as this can often be taken from the current playback mode.

member.summary:
Defines how the decoding of the current frame is performed.
Values can be:
'hardware' - Decoded by GPU
'software' - Decoded by Intel Media SDK
'fallback' - Decoded by Intel Media SDK, even though it was requested to be Hardware (or Auto)
'ipp' - Decoded by Intel UMC

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BookmarkService
member.summary:
Provides access to the bookmark service of the ServerCommandService.
Note that this service is only available on the high-end XProtect Corporate products.
For the products where it is not supported, each method entry is ignored and a single message is logged in the MIP log.
The methods of this service is invoked through the singleton reference 'Instance'.
E.g. A new bookmark may be created using the statement:
Bookmark bookmark1 = BookmarkService.Instance.BookmarkCreate(cameraFqid, timeBegin, timeTrigger, timeEnd, reference, header, description);
The 'Bookmark' class contains all the information related to the new bookmark, especially the BookmarkFQID property, which holds the unique identification of the new bookmark.
Existing bookmarks may be queried by BookmarkSearchTime or BookmarkSearchFromBookmark. BookmarkSearchTime searches for bookmarks within a specific time interval. BookmarkSearchFromBookmark begins the search from the time right after a specific existing bookmark.
The search may take several seconds. Therefore it may be relevant to use the asynchronous equivalents BookmarkSearchTimeAsync and BookmarkSearchFromBookmarkAsync in stead.
A known bookmark may be quieried by means of the BookmarkGet method

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BookmarkService.Instance
member.summary: This Singleton item of this class. Only the 'get' access should be used, as the class is created during MIP Environment startup.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BookmarkService.BookmarkCreate(VideoOS.Platform.FQID,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new bookmark. If a rule needs to be generated, set the reference to null, and the server will issue a new event "Bookmark Reference Requested" that can be used to trigger further actions.
Notice: To trigger a rule, the 'reference' parameter needs to be null.
member.param: The id of the device to which the Bookmark is to be registered. Mandatory
The begin time of the recording associated with this Bookmark. DateTime.MinValue => UtcNow - 10 seconds
The Bookmark trigger time. DateTime.MinValue => UtcNow
The end of the recording associated with this bookmark. DateTime.MinValue => TimeTrigged + 10 seconds
The reference field of the bookmark. Null => Autogenerated unique bookmark reference
The header field of the bookmark. Null => no header text
The description field of the bookmark. Null => no description text
member.returns: A new Bookmark instance. Null indicates an error

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BookmarkService.BookmarkSearchTime(VideoOS.Platform.ServerId,System.DateTime,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Guid[],VideoOS.Platform.FQID[],System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Search for bookmarks in a time interval. The call is synchronous, so it may take some time to return.
member.param: The ServerId of the management server to be searched for Bookmarks. Null = Master site.
Start time of the search interval. Mandatory
Period of time to search within (in microseconds). Mandatory
Maximum number of bookmarks to be returned in the result. Mandatory
The Kinds to be searched for. Null => all kinds
Array of Item identifications to search. Null => Any
Array of User names (the users that created the bookmark). Null => Ignored
Search string. To appear in either of the fields 'Reference', 'Header', 'Description'. Null => Ignored,
member.returns: Array of Bookmarks found. Null indicates an error

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.BookmarkService.BookmarkSearchFromBookmark(VideoOS.Platform.FQID,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Guid[],VideoOS.Platform.FQID[],System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Search from bookmarks after a known bookmark. The known bookmark is ignored. The call is synchronous, so it may take some time to return.
member.param: The bookmark after which to start search.
Period of time to search within (in microseconds). Mandatory
Maximum number of bookmarks to be returned in the result. Mandatory
The kinds of items to search within. Null => all kinds
Array of Devices to search. Null => Ignored
Array of User names (the users that created the bookmark). Null => Ignored
Search string. To appear in either of the fields 'Reference', 'Header', 'Description'. Null => Ignored,
member.returns: Array of Bookmarks found. Null indicates an error

Any mask defined on the server is applied as well.

The format contains a size definition and a series of rows, seperated by ';'
A 3 by 3 grid with top right square masked out is defined by:
3x3;001;000;000

member.summary: The list of Audio sources to export. Can be both microphones and Speakers.

member.summary:
Set to True, if exported database is to be compressed.

member.summary: Set to True if Encryption is required, also set the Password.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.ViewerPaths
member.summary: The path to the Viewer, and any language paths that should also be exported. Notice that the Viewer is no longer distributed with the Smart Client, and this field is ignored.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.Path
member.summary:
Where to store the export on hard disk.
Used when the ExportToDisk is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.ExportToDisk
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export hard disk.
The path of where to store the export is defined in the Path property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins.
Default value is true.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.ExportToMediaBurner
member.summary:
Specifies whether to export to an optical disc (i.e. DVD).
The drive letter of where to burn the export is defined in the MediaBurnerDriverLetter property.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.MediaBurnerDriverLetter
member.summary:
When the ExportToMediaBurner is set to true, the MediaBurnerDriverLetter is used to identify which burner to use.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
There is no default value, must be specified for MediaBurner exports.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.ExportName
member.summary:
Specific the name of the export. This value is used as a part of the path and a the name of the optical disc.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is a construction of current Date and Time

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.EncryptionStrength
member.summary:
Specifies the encryption strength.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins.
Default value is DES-56 bit

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.IncludePlayer
member.summary:
Specifies whether to include the Smart Client - Player or not.
This property is valid for Smart Client plug-ins only.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.SignExport
member.summary:
Specifies if the export should be signed.
This option is only available for exports in BLK format.
member.remarks: Default value is false

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.IncludeBookmarks
member.summary:
Specifies if the export should include bookmarks.
This option is only available for exports in BLK format.
member.remarks: Default value is false

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.PrivacyMask
member.summary:
An additional mask to be applied on all images.
Any mask defined on the server is applied as well.
member.remarks:
The format contains a size definition and a series of rows, seperated by ';'
A 3 by 3 grid with top right square masked out is defined by:
3x3;001;000;000

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DBExporter.PreventReExport
member.summary:
Specifies whether to prevent the end user from doing a new export from the Smart Client Player.
Default is false (allow reexport).
Only support for BLK format exports.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.IAVIExporter.SetOverlayImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies an overlay image to the exported video. The positioning and size are relative to the zoomed/cropped exported image (video). The method must be called prior to StartExport. For platform integrations this feature is only supported in combination with method.
member.param: The overlay image to be used. Should be in an alpha-enabled image color format (RGBA or BGRA) to be able to handle (semi-)transparent areas. Any other format will not support transparency.
The vertical position of the overlay image relative to the regular orientation of the output images, supports: Top, Centered and Bottom location - use defined constants.
The horizontal position of the overlay image relative to the regular orientation of the output images, supports: Left, Centered and Right - use defined constants.

Scale factor relative the output image size. The value of 1.0 indicates 100% size, and smaller means that the overlay will cover a smaller area of the image. Larger values will result in that the surplus will be cropped.
Flag indicating whether or not the aspect ratio is taken into account. The value of false will ensure aspect ratio correction, otherwise the overlaying is done directly on a pixel-to-pixel basis.
member.returns: True if successfully set the overlay image, otherwise false.

member.summary:
This MediaProvider provides an interface for sending video frames to a Milestone XProtect Recording Server.
The specific MIPMediaProvider driver has to be configured to point at this executing application and port, as defined in this class.

When the class is initialized, the TCP socket will be open for listen to new connection but no video will be sent.

member.name: E:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MediaProviderChannel.HandlePTZCommandEvent
member.summary:
When PTZ commands are issued by the VMS, this event will be called with a messageId and the corresponding data content.
A PTZ start move would f.ex. have the message id = MessageId.Control.PTZMoveStartCommand, and the data object will contain the Messaging.PTZMoveStartCommandData struct with the pan, tilt, zoom and speed information.

The MediaProviderService will open for TCP socket and listen for connections.
New MediaProvider's need to be created for each channel that will be available for video later on.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MediaProviderService.Init(System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Initializes the TCP service, and start to listen for incoming requests.
When the class is initialized, the TCP socket will be open for listen to new connection but no video will be sent. In this mode the administrator can add and configure the camera definition in the VMS system.
Please consider using the more secure version using SecureString for the password instead.
member.param: The TCP port to be used - as the server will connect this application.
The password to be used for incoming session validation
A dictionary of additional parameters to be sent to the server when requested.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if this method has already been called.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MediaProviderSession
member.summary:
Contains the properties that a given session is using.
When used on the initial SessionOpening method, it will contain the values as requested by the server side.
The application can then modify the values to what is relevant for the given application and session.
This class is created by the MediaProviderService when a new HTTP request has been received that want to receive a new stream.
Note that multiple MediaProviderSession classes can exist on the same MediaProvider when multiple servers are connecting to the same channel or when a XPE Administration Application is previewing while the Recording Server is active.
If the session is a metadata session, the properties related to video can be ignored.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MediaProviderSession.Channel
member.summary:
The channel number that was given in the CreateMediaProvider method.
The first channel is 1

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Data.MediaProviderSession.ApplicationCustomData
member.summary: This field can be used by the application for any use.

If set by this application, the value will be returned to the server and used as a default resolution.

member.summary: The length of a Gop in frames, e.g. 5 will be 1 - key frame and 4 - P frames

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.OutgoingSpeakerController
member.summary: The OutgoingSpeakerController sends an audio stream to a speaker. The audio stream can come from a pc-microphone or a file.

remarks.p: The audio stream is provided by an IAudioRecorder instance, which is linked to the controller by the Init call. E.g. from a microphone (AudioController) or a file (AudioStreamPlayer).
The timing of the stream is driven by the IAudioRecorder instance. I.e. it is responsible for keeping a pace near real time and a prebuffer to compensate for timing discrepancies.
The basic code to invoke the controller may look like this:
remarks.code: VideoOS.Platform.Data.Speaker.AudioStreamPlayer player = new VideoOS.Platform.Data.Speaker.AudioStreamPlayer( new System.IO.FileStream(filename, System.IO.FileMode.Open, System.IO.FileAccess.Read)); _outgoingSpeakerController.Init(player); //Assigns the player to the controller _outgoingSpeakerController.Connect(speakerFqid); //connects to the speaker and reserves it _outgoingSpeakerController.TransmitStart(); //starts the stream
remarks.p: The transmission of the audiostream will progress in the background. It may be stopped permanently invoking the Close method or temporarily by invoking TrasmitStop.

Note: In an application using the Windows UI, you need to assign the UIHandle to the UI thread. Also, you should not provide long timeouts in the call of Connect and Close, because it will block the UI thread.
remarks.para: The format for the audio file allways needs to be: PCM, sample rate=8000, mono, 16 bit wide samples. A reference can be found at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WAV with the sample file from the Wiki article at http://www.nch.com.au/acm/8k16bitpcm.wav

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Data.OutgoingSpeakerController._outgoingAudioTransmitLock
member.summary: Holds outgoing audio transmit lock value

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.ThumbnailQueue
member.summary:
Thumbnail queue (singleton) used for fetching thumbnail images from cameras in a controlled and optimized manner. Queue characteristics can be controlled in the app.config of the client application, otherwise default values are used. The following app settings can be configured in the app.config file to control the queue:
ThumbnailQueue.MaxConcurrentRecordingServers - Sets the maximum number of recording servers the queue can communicate with (in parallel) at any given time. ThumbnailQueue.MaxVideoSourcesPerRecordingServer - Sets the maximum number of instances that are initialized (in parallel) towards any single recording server. ThumbnailQueue.MaxConcurrentRequestsInTotal - Sets the maximum number of requests that can be processed at any given time (in parallel). ThumbnailQueue.MaxRecordingServerQueueIdleTimeMillis - Sets the maximum time a recording server queue can sit idle (i.e. not process any requests) before it is automatically shut down. ThumbnailQueue.MaxVideoSourceIdleTimeMillis - Sets the maximum time a resource can sit idle (i.e. not process any requests) before it is automatically shut down. ThumbnailQueue.ThumbnailCacheEnabled - Determines whether the up-front caching of thumbnails is used. This will give better performance, but at the cost of a slight increase in memory usage. ThumbnailQueue.MaxThumbnailCacheCapacity - Determines the maximum number of thumbnails stored in the cache. When adding a new thumbnail, the least recently used thumbnail is removed. ThumbnailQueue.ThumbnailCacheExpirationTimeMillis - Sets the expiration time (in milliseconds) which, if the "last use" timestamp of a thumbnail exceeds, will remove the thumbnail from the cache. Setting "0" will disable expiration. ThumbnailQueue.ThumbnailCreationThreadPoolSize - Sets the size of the dedicated thread pool used to convert s to s.

member.summary:
This class can be constructed with a specific Alert item as parameter. It will assist in getting specific alerts from the defined alert.
Notice: Alerts has been deprecated in XProtect Corporate from version 4.0 - consider to use bookmarks or alarms.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.AlertDataSource.#ctor(VideoOS.Platform.Item)
member.summary:
Construction of this class needs a reference to the alert to get alerts from.
Alerts in this context are the alerts defined in XProtect Corporate (Pre-version 4.0) or the hardware inputs and manual events defined in XProtect Enterprise.
It should also be noted that the originator that triggered this event, can not be retrieved when using alerts.
member.param: An alert Item

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Data.DataSource
member.summary:
An abstract class to be used for implementation of a DataSource.
Within the MIP Environment there are currently these built-in implementations:
AlertDataSource - to get access to video alerts
SequenceDataSource - to get access to recorded video related sequence information
StreamDataSource - to get the configured streams on a camera
MetadataSource - to get the configured metadata stream information on a metadata item
If a plug-in can provide list of data related to a specific Item, implementation of this class can be used.
Construction can be performed in two ways:
Call the GetDataSource() on the owning Item
Construct the correct class based on the Item at hand

Please note that all calls to the methods in this class MUST be coming from the same thread!

The height and width should be set to the lowest value that make sense for your application, e.g. don't ask for 1080x720 images if displaying thumbnails.

member.summary:
Define a cropping rectangle of what part of the image to pick out.
The values are all between 0.0 up to 1.0 as a relative part of the original image.
To crop out a lower right hand rectangle these values could apply:

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSource.GetNearest(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the nearest JPEG to the DateTime specified.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSource.GetAtOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Get the nearest JPEG to the DateTime specified.
This method is useful when being issued within a second of when the recording took place. e.g. close to real time. The actual recording may not have happened yet, and this method will then go back a few seconds instead of returning null.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSource.GoToWithResult(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.remarks:
This method will return true if the video pointer was moved - even if the time it was moved to is far in time from the requested time. False is only returned if the video pointer is not moved, which only happens in a few cases:
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Forward, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or after the requested time. Only if the requested time is after database end will GoToWithResultreturn false.
If the direction argument is PlaybackPlayModeData.Reverse, the method returns true if there is ANY video at or before the requested time. Only if the requested time is before database start will GoToWithResult return false.
If the direction argument is something else, it will return true, if there is any video and false only if the DB is empty.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available.
member.returns: True if the video pointer was moved; false if it did not move

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Data.JPEGVideoSource.GoTo(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the pointer as close to this time as possible.
member.param: The point in time that the video pointer should be moved to
Used to fine tune the direction to move if exact time stamp is not available.

Contains a string of chanacters defining what parts of the image need to be masked out.
It defines how big a matrix is defined, followed by a list of zero'es and one's for each row.
Can be null if no privacy mask has been defined.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdAndRelatedKindFilter
member.summary:
The MessageIdFilter will match on the provided MessageId and kind.
Only messages send with a specific messageId and where the message.RelatedFQID matches the given kind will be passed through the filter.
The matching string for the messageId may contain a '*' as the last character to allow for multiple matches, e.g. 'Control.PTZ*' will match almost all PTZ operations going on.
This filter is especially useful for the message.

member.summary: Checks if the given message text matches the messageId string specified on the constructor and the kind of the RelatedFQID of the message matches the kind specified. Match on messageId is case sensitive.
