member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage
member.summary:
A ExternalMessage contains information send from a sender to one or multiple receivers.
It is identified by a String, the well known messages created and send by the MIP Environment are defined in class VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.
The fields may be filled out or not filled out depending on the MessageId. The MessageId is the identification of the message, a plugin can use any MessageId they choose for additional communication.
The field Reason - is a string containing why this message has been send, could be the name of a rule, a black list, or simply a user action.
The RelatedFQID is used for some Messages – see documentation for each MessageId.
The Data field is simply an object relevant to the specific MessageId.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The Message contains a singe string as the ID.
member.param: The ID

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.#ctor(System.String,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary: The Message contains a single string as the ID. The message relates to the relatedFQID.
member.param: The Id of the message
FQID of a related Item to the Destination FQID

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.ExtensionData
member.summary: For use by SOAP, do not modify

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.MessageId
member.summary: The identification of the message begin sent. Built-in message id's are located in class Messaging.MessageId Plugin defined messages are suggested to be of a namespace format with the plugin type as the initial name. e.g. "MyPlugin.Info.PayAttention"

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.RelatedFQID
member.summary: The RelatedFQID identifies an Item that subject to an action/event, e.g. as a parameter. The destination FQID on the SendMessage is usually the one receiving the message and RelatedFQID.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.Data
member.summary:
The data can be any object as defined by the MessageId. Built-in messages uses a name format for the Data field like the messageId appended with 'Data'.
Notice that plug-in defined classes carried in the Data field MUST have the [Serialized] attribute defined, as the class is serialized with the DataContractSerialized class when transported from one machine to another.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.Reason
member.summary: The Reason is an informative field that can be used to display or trace additional reason for the Sending of this message.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.SourceEndPoint
member.summary: Filled by the MIP Environment during the Transmit handling, and identify the executing application.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.SourceEndPointType
member.summary: Filled by the MIP Environment during the Transmit handling, and identify the type of Communication EndPoint.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.Source
member.summary:
Contains the original source parameter for a SendMessage/PostMessage call, and identify the individual Item (class) within the application, that issued the call.
This can be used by the receiver on another machine to send back responses directly to the original source, within the original source EndPoint.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.Destination
member.summary: Contains the Destination parameter from the SendMessage/PostMessage call, and identify the individual Item (class) within the Destination Endpoint application, that should receive this message.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.DataClass
member.summary:
Contains the full name of the serialized Data field.
This field is filled and used by the MIP Environments.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ExternalMessage.DataClassContent
member.summary:
Contains the serialized content of the Data field.
This field is filled and used by the Data property.
When reading the Data property, this field is deserialized and the original class is returned. Multiple accesses to the Data field will reuse the same instance of the de-serialized class.
When writing to the Data field, the content is serialized and stored in this field.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication
member.summary:
Communication between EventServer and all other MIP Environments can be done via this class.
Each starting application or service will have one EndPoint ( Unique for each execution ), and a EndPointType.
The EventServer is defined as a EndPointType.Server and all other MIP Environments are in this context a EndPointType.Client.
Any MIP plug-in can get a list of all currently executing MIP Environments and store their EndPointFQID for communication purpose. For each EndPoint is is possible to get hold of the EndPointIdentityData class to identify the login user name for a given EndPoint. See the WhoAreOnlineRequest and WhoAreOnlineResponse MessageId's for more on this.
This class is created through the MessageCommunicationManager static class.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.ServerId
member.summary: Provide the ServerId used during the Start operation.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.Uri
member.summary: The Uri used for message communication

member.summary: Disposed internally

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.RegisterCommunicationFilter(VideoOS.Platform.MessageReceiver,VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.CommunicationIdFilter)
member.summary:
Register to receive specific messages, from any other machine.
Please use this filter mechanism with care, as it can impact network traffic.
Note: It can take 3-4 seconds before this registration takes effect! Use if you need to ensure it's registered

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.WaitForCommunicationFilterRegistration(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.CommunicationIdFilter)
member.summary: Waits for the communication filter to be registered on server. Use the overload with timeout if you wish to limit the wait.
member.param: The communication filter

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.WaitForCommunicationFilterRegistration(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.CommunicationIdFilter,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits for the communication filter to be registered on server Throws if the timeout is exceeded
member.param: The communication filter
Maximum timeout to wait, pass for unlimited waiting

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.RegisterCommunicationFilter(VideoOS.Platform.MessageReceiver,VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.CommunicationIdFilter,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.EndPointType)
member.summary:
Register to receive specific messages, from the specified EndPoint and EndpointType.
If the EndPoint is null, all EndPoints are requested to transmit the specific messages.
The filter information is send to the EventServer, and again forwarded to relevant clients. This will allow message filtering to be done at the source of the messages and keep network transmission to a minimum.
Filters are stored in the EventServer in case of short network problems, and will be re-transmitted to clients that are re-connecting within 60 seconds. If a client is not connected for 60 seconds, all filters issued on other machines to that machine will be deleted (Unregistered).
Note: It can take 3-4 seconds before this registration takes effect!
member.returns: An object to be used for UnRegistrationCommunicationFilter

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.UnRegisterCommunicationFilter(System.Object)
member.summary: To Unregister a previously registered filter.
member.param: The object returned from the RegisterCommunicationFilter method

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.TransmitMessage(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary:
Transmit a message. When destinationEndPoint is null, the message will be sent to the EventServer itself for processing, where the receiving message filters will be used to determine who should receive the message.
When the destinationEndPoint is filled, the message is first sent to the EventServer, that again will forward to the specified EndPoint - without any validation of the message filters.
Use of the destinationEndPoint is a direct way for two clients to communicate with each other without any filters.
If the destinationEndPoint is filled with an ObjectId of Guid.Empty - the message is considered a broadcast, and will be transmitted to all clients currently logged in.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunication.IsConnected
member.summary: Returns the status of the communication to the EventServer's Communication service.

Contains the FQID and the username used for login at that EndPoint identified by the EndPointFQID.
This class is used in conjunction with the WhoAreOnlineResponse and NewEndPointIndication messages.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ItemState
member.summary:
Defines the current state a given Item has.
This class is used in conjunction with the ProvideCurrentStateResponse message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ItemState.FQID
member.summary: Identify the current state for an Item. Can be a server, a camera or any Item from a Plug-in that has support for status information.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ItemState.State
member.summary:
Can contain one of these values:
"Unknown" - Dont know what the state really is
"Enabled" - Enabled by Milestone Management Client/App. , but device state not yet determined
"Disabled" - Disabled by Milestone Management Client/App.
"Responding" - Device is responding and OK
"Server Responding" - Server is alive
"Not Responding" - Device is enabled, but not responding
"Server Not Responding" - Server is not reachable
Other states that come from time to time, are not stored in the this field, but will be contained in the NewEventIndication message.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.EndPointType

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.EndPointType.Server
member.summary: Identify the Event Server communication instance.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.EndPointType.Client
member.summary: Identify all other MIP Environments than the Event Server, e.g. Smart Clients, .Net MIP Library, Administrators

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.EndPointType.Any

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager
P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager.EndPointType

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager.EndPointFQID
member.summary: Identifies the specific FQID identifying this application instance. If multiple Smart Clients or MIP .Net Library Environments are executing on the same machine, they all have unique FQIDs. A Smart Client closing down and started up again will have a new FQID - but a logout / login operation will keep the FQID the same.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager.Security
member.summary:
Defines what level of security this communication endpoint has. Default is Securitylevel.Normal.
This property can be changed by plug-ins to either increase or decrease the current security level, and will impact what messages are being transmitted from executing MIP Environment to another Environment.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager.SecurityLevel
member.summary:
Defines to what degree a communication endpoint (e.g. a Smart Client), will send messages to other applications and machines.
High = No messages are transmitted
Normal = All messages are transmitted, but received messages with "*Command" endings will be filtered out.
Low = All messages are transmitted and received.

member.summary: Stop the MessageCommunication client identified by a ServerId. Please note that multiple plug-ins can share same same clint, so this method should only be called when entire application is understood to not use this client anymore.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageCommunicationManager.Get(VideoOS.Platform.ServerId)
member.summary: Get the MessageCommunication class that communicates with a specific server, identified by ServerId. The communication to that server must have been started via the Start(ServerId) method before calling this method.

members.member:
This class can be used to filter messages coming from playbackcontrollers. By using this filter, only messages from the defined playbackcontroller will be received.
The default playback controller for floating windows can be retrieved via the WindowInformation property on the ViewItemUserControl.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PlaybackControllerFilter.#ctor(System.String,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message
member.summary:
A Message contains information send from a sender to one or multiple receivers. It is identified by a String, the well known messages created and send by the MIP Environment are defined in class VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.
The fields may be filled out or not filled out depending on the MessageId. The MessageId is the identification of the message, a plugin can use any MessageId they choose of additional communication.
The field Reason - is a string containing why this message has been send, could be the name of a rule, a black list, or simply a user action. The RelatedFQID is used for some Messages – see documentation for each MessageId. The Data field is simply an object relevant to the specific MessageId.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The Message contains a singe string as the ID.
member.param: The ID

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.#ctor(System.String,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary: The Message contains a single string as the ID. The message relates to the relatedFQID.
member.param: The Id of the message
FQID of a related Item to the Destination FQID

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: The Message contains a singe string as the ID and a Data object. T
member.param: The Id of the message
Can contain data to be send with the message, or data where fields can be filled by receiver

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.#ctor(System.String,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,System.Object)
member.summary: The Message contains a singe string as the ID.
member.param: The Id of the message
FQID of a related Item to the Destination FQID
Can contain data to be send with the message, or data where fields can be filled by receiver

member.summary: The Message contains a singe string as the ID.

FQID of a related Item to the Destination FQID
Can contain data to be send with the message, or data where fields can be filled by receiver
Explain why this message is being sent

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.MessageId
member.summary: The identification of the message begin sent. Built-in message id's are located in class Messaging.MessageId Plugin defined messages are suggested to be of a namespace format with the plugin type as the initial name. e.g. "MyPlugin.Info.PayAttention"

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.RelatedFQID
member.summary: The RelatedFQID identifies an Item that subject to an action/event, e.g. as a parameter. The destination FQID on the SendMessage is usually the one receiving the message and RelatedFQID.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.Data
member.summary: The data can be any object as defined by the MessageId. Built-in messages uses a name format for the Data field like the messageId appended with 'Data'

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.Reason
member.summary: The Reason is an informative field that can be used to display or trace additional reason for the Sending of this message.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message.ExternalMessageSourceEndPoint
member.summary:
If this message originated from another application, this FQID will identify the Source EndPoint's FQID.
This can be used for the destinationEndPoint if you need to replay back in the MessageCommunication.Transmit method.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageFilter
member.summary:
This class is the base class for classes that can assist in filtering messages.
The MessageIdFilter matches on the MessageId itself.
The AnyFilter is an always-true filter – most useful for debugging.
A plugin can create own filters as appropriate for matching and filtering on specific combination the available fields.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageFilter.Match(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary: Checks if the given message matches this filter.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdFilter
member.summary:
The MessageIdFilter will match on the MessageId itself.
Only messages send with a specific messageId will be passed through the filter.
The matching string may contain a '*' as the last character to allow for multiple matches, e.g. 'Control.PTZ*' will match almost all PTZ operations going on.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdFilter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The messageId defines what to look for, last character can be a '*'.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdFilter.Match(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary: Checks if the given message text matches the string specified on the constructor. Match is case sensitive.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdListFilter
member.summary:
This class will match the messageId of a message with a list of messageId's, if a match exists for one of these, the message is passed through the filter.
The '*' character cannot be used for this class.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdListFilter.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a message filter that filters on a list of id's

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageIdListFilter.Match(VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.Message,VideoOS.Platform.FQID,VideoOS.Platform.FQID)
member.summary: Check if a given MessageId matches any of the messages in the list provided at construction.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId
member.summary: The MessageId class contains the definitions of all the system defined messages.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System
member.summary: This class is a collection of static strings used for messages relevant on a system level.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ApplicationLoggedOnIndication
member.summary:
This message is send when the user has just logged on to a server.
Try avoiding to use this message, and instead use the Init() method on the different plug-in classes.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ApplicationLoggedOffIndication
member.summary:
This message is send when the user has just logged off a server.
Try avoiding to use this message, and instead use the Close() method on the different plug-in classes.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ApplicationExitIndication
member.summary:
This message has been deprecated.
Use the event instead.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ModeChangedIndication
member.summary: Is send when the Smart Client or the .Net Library MIP Environment has changed mode. The Data field contains the new Mode, as well as the EnvironmentManager.Mode Note: Do not use this message in Smart Client plugins. Instead use ShownWorkSpace, WorkSpaceState and associated messages.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ModeChangeCommand
member.summary:
Can be sent to the individual PlaybackController in the .Net Library MIP and Smart Client Environment when the application want to change mode for one PlaybackController and all related ImageViewerControl's.
The destination field must contain the FQID of the PlaybackController that should handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.SystemConfigurationChangedIndication
member.summary: This message is send when part of the Milestone configuration has changed in general. Please note that many of these message can be sent, and a plug-in should not re-load or re-check the entire Milestone configuration at every event.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.LocalConfigurationChangedIndication
member.summary:
When running with the .Net library, this message is sent when the memory copy of the configuration has been updated. This can happen as a result of a late connection to a sub-site, or an update to one recorder.
When MIP .Net Library has loaded configuration from a server, this message is fired with the RelatedFQID being the Management Server FQID.
When MIP .Net Library has updated configuration after hardware has been moved, or hardware being renamed, this message is being fired with the Data field containing a "List<FQID>" to identify each of the items that has changes (e.g. cameras or metadata items)

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.LoginTokenChangedIndication
F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.ApplicationRefreshTreeViewCommand
member.summary:
This message can be send by a plug-in in the administrators when the plug-in has an updated list of items to show in the TreeView.
This message should not be used during normal Add/Delete/Rename operations. The message will only work for the currently shown plug-in tree, and either the Data or the RelatedFQID.Kind of the message should match the Kind of the items that should be refreshed.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.LicenseChangedIndication
member.summary: When licenses has been activated, this event is send. You can afterwards call the GetLicense(pluginId) method to retrieve your licenses.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.LicenseAutomaticUpdateRequest
member.summary:
Can be sent by a MIP plug-in running in the Management Client or Management Administrator, to indicate that its license information has changed.
The environment will then call the PluginLicenseRequest methods to get a new set of license requests.
The information will be stored on the server and used during next automatic license activation - usually scheduled to be performed within a few minutes.
Note: Supported from 2016.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.System.RemovableMasksLiftedChangedIndication
member.summary:
Indicates that the removable masks lifted stated has changed.
Note: Supported from 2018.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient
member.summary:
This class is a collection of static strings mostly for use when executing in the Smart Client
The 4 playback message Id's can also be used for a ImageViewerControl running in the .Net Library.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SelectedCameraChangedIndication
member.summary:
Send when the user selects a new camera viewitem. RelatedFQID contains new ID
Notice: from 2017R3 floating windows will also issue this command, the 'sender' field will contain the FQID of the window sending this command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.GetSelectedCameraRequest
member.summary: To request the current selected camera FQID. The returned object is the selected camera FQID, or null if none is selected.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PlaybackCommand
member.summary: Playback Commands can used to sent to the Playback control - just as if a user had set the time on the UI control. The Data field need to be filled with the PlaybackCommandData structure, where the Command contains one of the commands defined in PlayBackData class, and for the GoTo command the PlaybackCommandData.DateTime field need to be filled.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PlaybackSkipModeCommand
member.summary:
Is used to instruct a PlaybackController what to do when end of a sequence (e.g. continues video) is reached on selected ImageViewerControl. The Data field is filled with one of the modes in: PlaybackSkipModeData, e.g. PlaybackSkipModeData.Skip, PlaybackSkipModeData.NoSkip, PlaybackSkipModeData.StopAtSequenceEnd.
The destination for the SendMessage must be the identification of the PlaybackController that should act on the command. This can be either null, for the built-in default playback controller, or the FQID returned from the creation of a playback controller ClientControl.Instance.GeneratePlaybackController().

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.GetCurrentPlaybackTimeRequest
member.summary:
This request can be send by a plug-in executing in the Smart Client and the .Net Library to retrieve the current time of the playback.
the result is a DateTime.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PlaybackIndication
member.summary:
When the PlaybackController has received a command to change speed, mode, direction etc - this message will be send with the Data field containing the PlaybackCommandData content.
This can be used to synchronize other kind of data and text with the video being shown.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PlaybackCurrentTimeIndication
member.summary:
The PlaybackCurrentTimeIndication can be used to retrieve display time when the playback UserControl, either because of user action or running playback.
If running normal speed playback, this message will be retrieved very often, e.g. 25 times a second.
The actual DateTime will be stored in the Message.Data field.
This message can be used to synchronize other kind of data and text with the video being shown.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PlaybackTimeInformation
member.summary:
This command is used to inform the PlaybackController at what time there is data from a specific Item.
The Data field must contain the PlaybackTimeInformationData class with relevant content.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ClearIndicatorCommand
member.summary:
Clear the motion and event indicators on the top bar of the ImageViewerControl.
The Data field need to contains one of the ClearIndicatorCommandData strings to instruct what to clear.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ApplicationControlCommand
member.summary: A set of commands to control how the Smart Client application panels looks. The Data field should contain one of the commands defined in ApplicationControlCommandData. The commands are the same as can be issued by the Smart Client user when is clicking or double clicking at specific places.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ChangeModeCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the Smart Client to change mode. The Data field should contain the new Mode.
Relevant values for the Smart Client are: ClientSetup, ClientLive and ClientPlayback
Note: Do not use this message in Smart Client plugins. Instead use ShownWorkSpace, WorkSpaceState and associated messages.
Note: For changing mode on a PlaybackController - see the System.ModeChangeCommand message

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ShowWorkSpaceCommand
member.summary: Instruct the Smart Client show a workspace. RelatedFQID contains the id of the work space to show.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ChangeWorkSpaceStateCommand
member.summary: Instruct the Smart Client to change the current workspace state. The Data field should contain the new workspace state.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ChangeThemeCommand
member.summary: Instruct the Smart Client to change the current theme. The Data field should contain the new theme.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ViewItemControlCommand
member.summary:
A command that can instruct the Smart Client to minimize and maximize a ViewItem, as well as tick the digital zoom check mark on or off.
The Data field should contain one of the commands defined in ViewItemControlCommandData.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.MultiWindowCommand
member.summary:
Contain a set of commands to control windows, views and screens for the Smart Client.
By this command you can select views, open and close floating windows and more.
The Data field must contain the MultiWindowCommandData structure filled with relevant fields. The MultiWindowCommandData field must contains one of the command contained in the MultiWindowCommand class, e.g. same namespace as this command!
What fields is used for each command is documented for each command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ViewGroupModifiedIndication
member.summary: This message is send by the Smart Client when a view group has been modified. The Data field is null.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SelectedViewChangedIndication
member.summary: Send by the Smart Client when a view has changed. The Data field contains the ViewAndLayoutItem for the new view, or null when a floating or secondary window is being closed. The sender FQID contains the id for the window, e.g. null or ObjectId == Kind.Window for main window, otherwise a specific FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ViewGroupsLoadedIndication
member.summary: This message is sent by the Smart Client when all view groups has been loaded. Use the ClientControl.Instance.GetViewGroupItems() or ClientControl.Instance.GetSmartWallItems() to access the view groups.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.WindowStateChangedIndication
member.summary: Send when a window has changed state, the sender FQID identifies the window being changed, where main window is null.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ShownWorkSpaceChangedIndication
member.summary: Is send when the Smart Client changed the shown workspace. The Data field contains the item for the new workspace.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.WorkSpaceStateChangedIndication
member.summary: Is send when the Smart Client workspace state has changed. The Data field contains the new WorkSpaceState.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ThemeChangedIndication
member.summary: Is send when the Smart Client theme has changed. The Data field contains the new theme.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SetCameraInViewCommand
member.summary: This command requires the SetCameraInViewCommandData to be filled and assigned in the Data field.
member.remarks:
The Data contains a camera FQID and the index it should be inserted in. The index is numbered from zero to the max number of view items. The top left viewitem is index zero for all built-in view layouts, but can be different for plug-in developed view layouts.
The SendMessage() method or PostMessage() method will pass on this command to the window identified by the destination FQID. The window FQID can come from the MultiWindowCommand.OpenFloatingWindow or found through ItemPicker dialog or some search method.
The modification is NOT saved permanently. Note that you can send this command with CameraFQID = null to remove the current camera.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartClientMessageCommand
member.summary:
Identifies that a message is to be displayed to the operator. Currently the message is displayed in the message bar located at the top of the main Smart Client window. The message is configured by filling out a SmartClientMessageData object that is added to the Data field of the message command. The Message can be updated by successive message commands with a SmartClientMessageData containing the same messageId.
Use the properties of SmartClientMessageData to control the appearance of the message. E.g. display a button or a progress bar as part of the messages, or control whether the user can close the message or not.
Set up message listeners on SmartClientMessageButtonClickedIndication and SmartClientMessageRemovedIndication to get notifications about when the user clicks the message button or the message is removed respectively.
The Data field needs to be filled with the SmartClientMessageData class. Setting the SmartClientMessageData.Message to string.Empty will remove the message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartClientMessageButtonClickedIndication
member.summary: This message is sent within the SmartClient when a message button is clicked by the user. The Data field contains the MessageId of the relevant job message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartClientMessageRemovedIndication
member.summary: This message is sent within the SmartClient when a message created by a plugin is removed from the UI. The Data field contains the MessageId of the relevant job message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartClientTimeZoneChangedIndication
member.summary:
This message is sent within the SmartClient when the ClientControl.SelectedTimeZone has changed.
The plugin should display all date/time information in the selected time zone.
The Data field contains the new TimeZoneInfo.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SetSelectedViewItemCommand
member.summary:
Set a specific ViewItem as selected within current Window.
The SetSelectedViewItemData needs to be filled and assigned to the Data field of the message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SelectedViewItemChangedIndication
member.summary: Is send by the Smart Client when the operator selects any ViewItem. The RelatedFQID identifies the selected ViewItem, and can be used to match up with the ViewAndLayoutItem (and children) send out by the SelectedViewChangedIndication.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.TalkToSpeakerCommand
member.summary: To open the PC microphone for audio going from PC to speaker attached to selected camera.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SelectSpeakerCommand
member.summary:
Sets the selected speaker in the Smart Client's side panel to RelatedFQID passed with this message.
Note: Only works in the Smart Client.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SelectMicrophoneCommand
member.summary:
Sets the selected microphone in the Smart Client's side panel to RelatedFQID passed with this message.
Note: Only works in the Smart Client.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ReloadConfigurationCommand
member.summary: This message will reload the entire configuration from all sites and all views from the server. This message takes time, please use with care.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.ShowCamerasInFloatingWindowCommand
member.summary:
Creates a new floating window with a set of cameras.
The Data field needs to be filled with the ShowCamerasInFloatingWindowData class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.WorkSpaceReadyIndication
member.summary: This indication is fired after the ApplicationLoggedOnIndication, as an indication that the workspaces has been created in the Smart Client, and all workspace commands can be used.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.GetTimelineSelectedIntervalRequest
member.summary:
This request can be send by a plug-in executing in the Smart Client to retrieve the current selected interval of the timeline.
The destination should be null for the main window timeline and otherwise the FQID of the playback controller for any other window.
The result is a or if no selection is available.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.PtzCommandOccurredIndication
member.summary: Send when the operator moves a camera. The RelatedFQID contains the camera's FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.RefreshTimelineRequest
member.summary: Instruct the Smart Client to refresh the time in relation to the device in RelatedFQID. The Data field is not used for this message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapGoToPositionCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the Smart Map to go to a specific coordinate.
The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapGoToAreaCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the Smart Map to go to a specific area. The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapGoToLocationCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the Smart Map to go to a specific location. The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapSelectItemCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the Smart Map to go to and select an item. Currently, it only supports Camera item The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapGetPositionRequest
member.summary:
Request the currently shown position from the Smart Map.
The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
The response will be an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.SmartMapPositionChangedIndication
member.summary:
This message is sent by Smart Client when a Smart Map position is changed in Smart Client, for instance, when there is panning or zooming action on the map. The Data field needs to be filled with an instance of the class.
Destination parameter of SendMessage/PostMessage is ignored. Destination instance is specified in the data object.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.SmartClient.GetCurrentWorkspaceRequest
member.summary:
Request the currently shown workspace for the window specified in the destination parameter.
The Destination parameter of SendMessage is used to identify from which window to get the result. Default (or null) means main window.
The response will be the item representing the workspace.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server
member.summary: This class is a collection of static strings for server communications. The event and alarm messages will be sent to the EventServer and others represent communication to the logon server.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewEventCommand
member.summary:
Plug-ins sends a Message with this message id to inform the Event Server of a new event. If this is sent in the Smart Client or when running with the .Net Library, it will be transfered to the event server over a SOAP protocol. The EventServer will process the message for possible storage in the alarm database if it finds a match in one of the alarm definition.
The Data field of the message can contain either an EventData or an AnalyticsEvent class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewEventsCommand
member.summary:
Should only be used in Event Server. Plug-ins sends a Message with this message id to inform the Event Server of mulitple new events. The EventServer will process the events contained in the message for possible storage in the alarm database if it finds a match in one of the alarm definition.
The Data field of the message should contain an IEnumerable containing object of either the EventData or the AnalyticsEvent class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewAlarmCommand
member.summary:
Plug-ins can send this message with an Alarm class in the Data field, to have the EventServer store the Alarm into the database.
The Alarm will be stored unaltered except for these fields:
- State will be set to "New"

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewEventIndication
member.summary:
This message Id is SEND by the Event server, to inform others that a new event has occurred.
Plug-in's running in the event server will be able to retrieve this message using the RegisterReceiver method. For receiving this message in other Environments than the event server, use the MessageCommunication classes.
member.remarks:
Only register to listen for either: NewEventIndication or NewEventsIndication
If a receiver listen for the NewEventIndication, the MIP Environment will split the NewEventsIndication into seperate messages - in order to be backwards compatible.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewEventsIndication
member.summary:
This message Id is SEND by the Event server, to inform others that one or more new events has occurred.
Plug-in's running in the event server will be able to retrieve this message using the RegisterReceiver method. For receiving this message in other Environments than the event server, use the MessageCommunication classes.
member.remarks:
Only register to listen for either: NewEventIndication or NewEventsIndication
If a receiver listen for the NewEventIndication, the MIP Environment will split the NewEventsIndication into seperate messages - in order to be backwards compatible.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewAlarmIndication
member.summary:
This message Id is SEND by the Event server, to inform others that a new alarm has occurred.
When running in other Environments, the MessageCommunication classes can be used to retrieve the NewAlarmIndication from the Event Server.
Note: In the Smart Client, changes to an Alarm will also use the NewAlarmIndication to send out the changes in an AlarmLine class. You will need to try to cast the Message.Data to both the Alarm and the AlarmLine to identify which one it is.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.ConfigurationChangedIndication
member.summary:
This message is being sent by the Environment to indicate that some part of a plug-in configuration has changed.
The Message.RelatedFQID defines the top most Item that has changed. If the specific Item is not known only the Kind is filled with relevant content.
You may use this information to reload from this Item and all it's children.
The EventServer will use this information to reload a plug-ins Items and refresh relevant Maps.
Please note that video management server configuration changes are being notified by the similar message under the System namespace (System.SystemConfigurationChangedIndication).
This feature requires the EnvironmentManager.Instance.EnableConfigurationChangedService = true;

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.RecorderFQIDChangedIndication
member.summary: This message ID is used when a failover has occurred in a Corporate system. The Message.RelatedFQID defines the recorder that has an updated address (WebServerUri). Note: This message is enabled by the VideoOS.Platform.SDK.Environment.Login() method is called.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.ChangedAlarmIndication
member.summary: This message is send within the Event Server environment, when one or many alarms has been changed. The Message.Data field contains a ChangedAlarmData class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.ChangedAlarmHistoryIndication
member.summary: This message is send within the Event Server environment, when one or more alarm histories has been updated. The Message.Data field contains a ChangedAlarmHistoriesData class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewEventAsAlarmHandlerCommand
member.summary: Deprecated - see Server.NewAlarmCommand

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewAlertAsAlarmHandlerCommand
member.summary: Deprecated - see Server.NewEventCommand

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewAlarmAsEventCommand
member.summary: Deprecated - see Server.NewEventCommand

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.EventCommand
member.summary: Deprecated - see Server.NewEventCommand

members.member:
To request IP address for a given camera. The Related FQID is the camera you need information about. The returned object is a string with the IP address.
Note: This only works in the EventServer from MIP v4 (EventServer 3.1a)
Note: From 2016 can be used everywhere. When transmissted on the MessageCommunication the Event Server will respond with a GetIPAddressResponse message where the Data contains the cameras IP address.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.GetIPAddressResponse
member.summary:
The response to the GetIPAddressRequest, when transmitted on the MessageCommunication to the event server.
The Data field of the response contains result as a string like "http://1.2.3.4" or "http://1.2.3.4:5555".
Note: Can only identify address of cameras, all other items will respond with null or blank.
(Supported from 2016)

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.NewAlarmUpdatedIndication
member.summary: This message is send within the Event Server environment, when one or more alarm updates (activities) has been added to an alarm. The Message.Data field contains a NewAlarmUpdateData class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.GetMapRequest
member.summary:
This request can be used in the Smart Client to get a list of child maps.
The Message.Data is filled with a MapRequestData containing a serverId and the id of the current map to get child maps for. Use ID = "" for the top map.
The result will be send in a new message with id GetMapResponse.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.GetMapResponse
member.summary: Is sent as a result of a GetMapRequest. The message.Data field contains a MapResponseData class.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.GetAnalyticsMessagesRequest
member.summary:
Is used to get a list of all configured Analytics messages.
The request is serviced by the Event Server, so event server plugin can use "SendMessage" while support from other environments will need to use MessageCommunication.
Please register the message: GetAnalyticsMessagesRequest for the returning response.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.GetAnalyticsMessagesResponse
member.summary:
Contains a response to the GetAnalyticsMessagesRequest message.
The message.Data field contains an array of AnalyticsMessageData

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Server.MipItemPositionChangedIndication
member.summary:
This message ID is used when the PositioningInformation property of a MIP plugin item has changed.
The property of the message will contain the ID of the item that has moved and the property will contain the new value.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR
member.summary: This class is a collection of static strings for subscribing to LPR match lists related events.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.AddLicensePlateListIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when a license plate list is added
The property will contain Tuple<Guid, string> (listId, name) value.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.RenameLicensePlateListIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when a license plate list is renamed, or its properties are changed (triggered events, custom fields)
The property will contain Tuple<Guid, string> (listId, name) value.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.DeleteLicensePlateListIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when one or more license plate lists are deleted
The property will contain Guid[] with deleted ids.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.AddLicensePlatesIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when license plates are added or modified in the list
The property will contain Tuple<Guid, string[]> (list id, affected registration numbers).

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.DeleteLicensePlatesIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when license plates are deleted from the list
The property will contain Tuple<Guid, string[]> (list id, deleted registration numbers).

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.LPR.ClearLicensePlatesIndication
member.summary:
Is sent when all license plates are cleared from the list
The property will contain Guid - the id of the list.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control
member.summary: This class is a collection of static strings for controlling camera or triggering events.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.TriggerCommand
member.summary:
Send this message to trigger a specific action on an Item.
Built-in actions supports: Outputs, Presets, Matrix and User-defined events.
member.remarks:
The Message.RelatedFQID defines the Item to work with (e.g. the parameter).
The PostMessage or SendMessage method will send the message to the destination FQID that is the point to perform the action.
To trigger a User-Defined event with camaraFqid as parameter (Parameter only works with Corporate):
Message message = new Message(MessageId.Control.TriggerCommand, cameraFqid); EnvironmentManager.Instance.PostMessage(message, eventFqid);
From 2017 R2 the message.Data field can also be filled with a List<FQID> to provide a list of items to be used as parameters. This is useful when defining a rule that uses multiple device ids as parameter to the rule.
Note: The Management Client does not support triggering with camera FQID as paremeter(s).
To trigger preset:
Message message = new Message(MessageId.Control.TriggerCommand); EnvironmentManager.Instance.PostMessage(message, presetFqid);
Plug-ins executing in the Event Server Environment that has MAP support and context-menu actions, needs to Register a MessageReceiver for this message, as context menu actions will be send back from the Smart Client MAP to the EventServer plugin as a TriggerCommand message. See the SensorMonitor (former AccessControl) sample for more.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.StartRecordingCommand
member.summary: Send this command to start recording on a specific camera. Make sure to also send the StopRecording message at a later point. The Destination FQID is identifying the camera.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.StopRecordingCommand
member.summary: Send this command to stop recording on a specific camera. The Destination FQID is identifying the camera.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZMoveCommand
member.summary:
The PTZMoveCommand will instruct a camera to perform one of the commands defined in the PTZMoveCommandData class.
The Data field must be filled with a PTZMoveCommandData structure.
The Destination FQID is identifying the camera the command should be performed on.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZCenterCommand
member.summary:
Instructs the camera to center and zoom based on a defined rectangle and zoom factor.
The Data field must be filled with a PTZCenterCommandData structure.
The Destination FQID is identifying the camera.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZRectangleCommand
member.summary: Send a PTZRectangleCommand to a camera. The Data field is a filled PTZRectangleCommandData structure. Destination contains camera FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZAUXCommand
member.summary: Control one AUX device on a camera/video server. The Data field is a filled PTZAUXCommandData structure. Destination contains camera FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommand
member.summary: Instruct a camera to move to a specific position. Data needs to be set to a filled PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData structure. Destination contains camera FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZMoveStartCommand
member.summary:
Instruct the camera to start moving in a specific direction. Data needs to be set to a filled PTZMoveStartCommandData or PTZMoveStartCommandData2 structure. Destination contains camera FQID.
Use the PTZMoveStopCommand to stop it again.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZMoveStopCommand
member.summary: This command will stop the movement issued by the PTZMoveStartCommand.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.PTZGetAbsoluteRequest
member.summary: Get the current absolute position of the camera. Result is returned in a PTZGetAbsoluteRequestData structure. Destination contains camera FQID.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.LensCommand
member.summary:
Used to instruct a camera to change some lens settings.
Destination contains camera FQID.
Please note that actual support is limited by what the specific camera can support and when Milestone have implemented in the drivers.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.OutputActivate
member.summary: Send this message to an output Item, and the output is activated.
member.remarks: Only supported for Corporate and Expert systems

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.OutputDeactivate
member.summary: Send this message to an output Item, and the output is deactivated.
member.remarks: Only supported for Corporate and Expert systems

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.RecorderErrorIndication
member.summary:
Is send by MIP SDK .Net component when a protocol error has happened on the RecorderServerCommand SOAP interface. The Data field contains details of the error. Can be used to understand if trigger commands and PTZ commands was rejected by the server.
The sender FQID identifies the camera or output the command was intended for.
New from MIPSDK 2016.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallPresetActivateCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, by activating the Video Wall Preset.
The Data is not used.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorPresetFQID to be activated.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallShowTextCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, by displaying a text string on a given position.
The Data field must contain the class with instruction of what to change.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallSetLayoutCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control the layout used on a Video Wall monitor.
The Data field must contain the class with instruction of what to change.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallSetLayoutAndCamerasCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, the layout to be applyed, and set specific devices on the monitor.
The Data field must contain the class with instruction of what to change.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallSetCamerasCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, and set specific devices on the monitor.
The Data field must contain the class with instruction of what to change.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallRemoveCamerasCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, and remove specific devices from the monitor.
The Data field must contain the class with instruction of what devices to remove.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallApplyXmlCommand
member.summary:
Send this command to control what is displayed on a Video Wall monitor, by constructing a new view as defined by the xml. This command will apply the inner list of xml items starting at the given position.
The xml must have the following format:
<viewitems> <viewitem> <iteminfo ... attributes filled in here /> <properties> ... a list of property nodes </properties> </viewitem> <viewitem> ... next viewitem </viewitem> </viewitems>
Please use the VideoVallController sample for complete content.
The Data field must contain the class with the xml content to display.
The Destination FQID needs to be the MonitorFQID to handle the command.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.VideoWallIndication
member.summary:
This indication is sent from the Event Server when changes to one of the Video Wall happens.
The Data field contains the class.
Changes can be to the Video Wall itself, the monitors, or the view displayed on the monitors.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.DriverCommand
member.summary:
Used to send device specific commands to a device through the Recording Server.
The Data field is filled with DriverCommandData, and the command is send with 'destination' FQID identifies the device.
The response is received via the DriverResponse message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MessageId.Control.DriverResponse
member.summary: Response to a DriverCommand. The Data field contains the DriverResponseData.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverCommandData
member.summary: Use with MessageId = DriverCommand.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverCommandData.SyncObject
member.summary: Can be used by the sender to sync responses with commands, could e.g. be the camera Item.

summary.para: The command to be send by the driver to the device, as a relative URI.
Set to include a query string; do not include the query string in .

value.para: You must prefix the command with either "GET:" or "POST:", e.g.:

summary.para: The GET query string or POST data.
Do not prepend the query string with "?".

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverResponseData
member.summary: The response coming back from sending a message with MessageId = DriverCommand

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverResponseData.SyncObject
member.summary: The same value as filled on the DriverCommandData

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverResponseData.Response
member.summary: The response from the device, or null if no response or error

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverResponseData.Success
member.summary: Indicates if the Response field contains a string received from the device. In case of this field being false the ErrorText contains exception text or driver reported issue.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.DriverResponseData.ErrorText
member.summary: When command failed, this field contains the exception message or an error from the recording server or driver.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.VideoWallShowTextCommandData
member.summary:
Contains information for what to change on the Video Wall.
Note: Configuration changes can be performed via the Configuration API and related classes.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.VideoWallShowTextCommandData.Text

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.VideoWallIndicationData
member.summary:
Contains description of a change on a video wall.
The changes can contain types of video wall, Monitor or View on a Monitor.
The ActionId defines what change has occurred:
- ADDED : When a video wall or Monitor has been added
- DELETED : When a video wall or Monitor has been deleted
- UPDATED : When name on video wall or Monitor has changed, or when the View / Layout has changed on a Monitor
The

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData
member.summary:
This class is contained on the Server.ChangedAlarmIndication.
The content identifies what changes has been made.
When changes only involved a single alarm, the ChangeHint is ChangeHintSingleAlarm and the AlarmId can be used to get the alarm again.
When changes involves a number of alarms on a specific source, the ChangeHint is ChangeHistMassUpdateForSource, and the SourceId can be used to run though alarms for that source and check the changes.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.AlarmId
member.summary: The Id of the individual alarm.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.SourceId
member.summary: The Id of the source of the alarm, e.g. a camera or event Id. Can be Guid.Empty when unknown.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.AlarmsDeletedBefore
member.summary: Some alarms before this date has been deleted.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.AlarmsDeletedBeforeClosed
member.summary: Some alarms before this time has been closed.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.ChangeHint
member.summary: Defines in what area the change has occurred, defined values are defined in this class, starting with 'ChangeHint...' names.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.ChangeHintSingleAlarm
member.summary: One alarm has been changed, could be state or any other field. The AlarmId is filled with the id of the alarm.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.ChangeHintMultipleAlarmsDeleted
member.summary: Multiple alarms has been deleted. They cannot be read from the database anymore. The two DateTime fields contains the xx since last AlarmLine modified ..

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.ChangedAlarmData.ChangeHintMassUpdateForSource
member.summary: All alarms from a specific source has been changed. The SourceId identify the source.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveStartCommandData2.Tilt
member.summary: A number indicating the "up - down" movement. Values must be -1 , 0 or 1. See also samples in the details section.

member.summary: A number indicating the zoom movement. Values must be -1, 0 or 1. See also samples in the details section.

member.summary: A number indicating the speed of the Pan direction.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData
member.summary: A struct specifying the PTZ and speed of a PTZMoveAbsoluteCommand message, used in the message's Data field.
member.remarks:
The values for Pan an Tilt are between -1..1 or NaN if no movement should be performed.
The value for Zoom are in interval 0..1 or Nan, where 0=full zoom out; 1=full zoom in; NaN=no zoom change.
The value for Speed is in the interval 0..1.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData.Pan
member.summary: The values for Pan are between -1..1 or NaN.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData.Tilt
member.summary: The values for Tilt are between -1..1 or NaN.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData.Zoom
member.summary: The value for Zoom are in interval 0..1, where 0=full zoom out; 1=full zoom in; NaN=no zoom change.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData.Speed
member.summary: The value for Speed is in the interval 0..1.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZMoveAbsoluteCommandData.AllowRepeats
member.summary: Set to true, if you want all commands to be sent - even when the content has same values.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZCenterCommandData
member.summary:
Defines a rectangle in witch to center and zoom.
- RefWidth : Width of the image to center camera in. Value is in pixels.
- RefHeight: Height of the image to center camera in. Value is in pixels.
- CenterX : X-coordinate of where to center camera. Value is in pixels.
- CenterY : Y-coordinate of where to center camera. Value is in pixels.
- Zoom : Zoom level where are in interval [0-1] and 0=full zoom out; 1=full zoom in; <0=no change.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.PTZRectangleCommandData
member.summary: Defines a rectangle to be displayed. All values are in pixels.

member.summary: A zero based index for where to update the cameraFQID.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SetSelectedViewItemData
member.summary: This class is used by the SetSelectedViewItemCommand message id. It describes what viewitem should be selected within the currently selected window.
member.remarks:
To select a specific ViewItem, set the LayoutIndex to the index of the ViewItem, top left is index 0. To move from one ViewItem to another, specify the MoveCommand.MoveUp / MoveDown etc
To De-Select current selected item, specify MoveCommand.Deselect
Notice that when multiple Windows are open, a specific Window might also have to be selected. See the MultiWindowCommand message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SetSelectedViewItemData.LayoutIndex
member.summary: Specify an index when MoveCommand = MoveCommand.MoveIndex. Ignored for other commands

member.summary: Specify one of the commands under MessageId.MoveCommand

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MoveCommand
member.summary: The commands available for the SetSelectedViewItemData message.

member.name: F:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.MultiWindowCommandData.PlaybackSupportedInFloatingWindow

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData
member.summary:
Contains a single message to be displayed in the message area of the Smart Client.
This class is used to display new messages in the message area of the Smart Client, as well as changing or removing existing messages.
Fill this class when sending a message with id SmartClient.SmartClientMessageCommand.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.MessageId
member.summary:
A unique ID of this message. Can be used to update or remove the the message at a later time.
All messages must have a unique ID.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.Message
member.summary:
The text to be displayed.
When the text is blank, an old message is removed.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.MessageType
member.summary:
Indicates type of message: None, Warning, Error, Task.
The default value is SmartClientMessageDataType.Error

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.Priority
member.summary:
The priority of the message: High, Normal, Low.
This value is currently not user by the Smart Client. The default value is SmartClientMessageDataPriority.Normal.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.IsClosable
member.summary: Indicates whether the user can close/remove the message manually. The default value is false.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.ButtonText
member.summary: The text of the button to show as part of the message. If the text is empty no button will be shown. The default value is string.Empty;.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.TaskState
member.summary:
Indicates the current state of the task: Pending, Running, Complete, Canceled, Failed.
Only used when the MessageType is set to SmartClientMessageDataType.Task. The default value is SmartClientMessageDataTaskState.Complete.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.TaskProgress
member.summary:
Indicates the current progress of the task. The value must be between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive)
Only used when the MessageType is set to SmartClientMessageDataType.Task. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageData.TaskText
member.summary:
Indicates the text associated with the curent task progress. Current this is displayed af part of the task progress indication in the Smart Client.
Only used when the MessageType is set to SmartClientMessageDataType.Task. The default value is string.Empty.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageDataPriority
member.summary: The priority of the message. Used by SmartClientMessageData. The content is currently not used by the Smart Client.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Messaging.SmartClientMessageDataType
member.summary:
The type of the message. Used by SmartClientMessageData.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Metadata.MetadataXml
member.summary: A nametable for Metadata XML used for speeding up processing and centralizing names. This works by only instantiating a specific string once, thereby making reference comparisons possible for string matching. All XML names (elements and attributes) *must* be public static read-only string. Otherwise the reflection logic will fail to add the names to the .

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientFactory
member.summary: Factory to create alarm clients

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientFactory.Create(VideoOS.Platform.ServerId,System.String,System.Version,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates IAlarmClient based on server identification.
The serverId is used to identify the VMS system that contains the EventServer you are about to communicate with. For a single VMS system, you can use the EnvironmentManager.Instance.MasterSite.FQID.ServerId, as there is only one server to login to in the system.
Note, that for a Federated Architecture deployment, each federated site will have each own EventServer and alarm database.
If XProtect Enterprise or Professional with slave setup might be used by your customers or XProtect Corporate, then the ServerId should be stored in relation to the AlarmClient where you received the Alarm in the first place. This could be done by simply walk through all the sites in the EnvironmentManager.Instance.MasterSite, and create one AlarmClient for each site - a Dictionary with ServerId, AlarmClient would then be contain the required information for managing the alarms later.
Another choice is to pick the ServerId from the Alarm (or EventBase) source FQID. Be aware that the system will then automatically try to get from the provided FQID.ServerId (if it points to a Recorder), to the ServerId where the VMS Server where the Recorder belongs. This is done via the FQID.GetParent() method.
member.param: Server id
Event server uri
Event server version
If is Basic user

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientManager
member.summary: The alarm client manager can be used in order to handle alarm client . The alarm client manager will create a alarm client to use when handling alarms. The client is created based on a server id which is the server to get the alarms from. In order to receive alarms from the server it must have a Event Server running. The alarm client manager will keep track of created clients and handle caching of the clients.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientManager.GetAlarmClient(VideoOS.Platform.ServerId)
member.summary: Get an alarm client for a specific server. This call can be called on every alarm client execution without overhead.
member.param: The server id of the server to connect to
member.exception: Thrown if either the event server is not registered or if the client fails to be constructed
member.returns: Alarm client

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientManager.Clear(VideoOS.Platform.ServerId)
member.summary: Clears the manager for the client related to the given server
member.param: Id of the server for which to close and remove the client

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.AlarmClientManager.Clear
member.summary: Clears and closes all clients from the manager

member.summary: If we have the ServerId of a XPCORS, or a XPE slave, try get hold of the ServerId for the Mgt Server, as it points to the Registered services.

member.summary: Create alarm command client.

member.returns: Alarm client

member.summary: Gets the event server version including major, minor and revision information.
member.param: Event Server URI Info
member.returns: Version

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient
member.summary: The alarm client is used to handle alarm specific actions. The client can be used to both add and get alarms. Updates of already existing alarms can be done primarily updating the alarm management field such as alarm state and and owner. The alarm history can also be received which is the collection of all the changes made to a specific alarm. This interface wrappes both alarm clients against XProtect Enterprise and XProtect Corporate.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.Add(VideoOS.Platform.Data.Alarm)
member.summary: Add an alarm to the Event Server. No filtering and manipulation is done on the way to the database and the alarm structure is preserved in the database. This means that adding the alarm and getting it afterwards using the Alarm.Eventheader.ID will result in an alarm containing the same data fields.
member.param: Alarm
member.exception: Thrown if the alarm is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.AddAsEvent(VideoOS.Platform.Data.Alarm)
member.summary: Add alarm as event (deprecated)
member.param: Alarm
member.exception: Thrown if the alarm is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.AddEvent(VideoOS.Platform.Data.BaseEvent)
member.summary: Add an event to the Event Server. The event is checked and filtered in the Event Server against the user defined alarm definitions. Alarms are created based on the baseEvent data on every matching alarm definition. The match criteria is the BaseEvent.EventHeader.Message which match the alarm definition event message and the BaseEvent.EventHeader.Source.FQID.ObjectId which matches the source. The alarms created gets the alarm definition details added as data and the alarm is given a unique id.
member.param: Event
member.exception: Thrown if the alarm is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.Get(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a specific alarm based on the input id.
member.param: Alarm id
member.exception: Thrown if the alarm is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.
member.returns: Alarm

member.summary: Gets a specific event based on the input id.
member.param: Event id
member.exception: Thrown if the id is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.
member.returns: Event

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.GetAlarmLines(System.Int32,System.Int32,VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.AlarmFilter)
member.summary: Gets alarm lines based on alarm filter. The lines received is a subset of the full set of alarm lines that satisfies the filter conditions. The subset is received based on the "from" and "maxCount" input parameters. An example: Get the newest 100 alarm lines where the alarm state is In Progress (state = 4). The alarm lines should be returned in descending time order. Help on constructing the alarm filter matching this, see the Alarm filter documentation. The "from" parameter should be set to 0 meaning the start of the resulting matching set and the "maxCount" parameter is set to 100.
member.param: Start of alarm lines.
Max count of received alarm lines
The alarm filter
member.exception: Thrown if the alarm is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication error.
member.returns: List of alarm lines

member.name: M:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.AlarmClient.IAlarmClient.GetEventLines(System.Int32,System.Int32,VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.EventFilter)
member.summary: Gets event lines based on event filter. The lines received is a subset of the full set of event lines that satisfies the filter conditions. The subset is received based on the "from" and "maxCount" input parameters. An example: Get the newest 100 event lines where the event name contains "My event". The event lines should be returned in descending time order. Help on constructing the event filter matching this, see the event filter documentation. The "from" parameter should be set to 0 meaning the start of the resulting matching set and the "maxCount" parameter is set to 100.
member.param: Start of event lines.
Max count of received event lines
The event filter
member.exception: Thrown if the event id is rejected by the Event Server
Thrown on communication errors.
member.returns: List of event lines

Updates a set of fields on a given alarm. The alarm to update is identified by the id.
The updates parameter defines what fields to update, and what value to assign to them.
The following fields can be updated:
- "AssignedTo"
- "Comment"
- "Priority"
- "PriorityInt"
- "PriorityName"
- "ReasonCode"
- "State"
- "StateInt"
- "StateName"
member.exception: Thrown if invalid field key or value
member.param: Id of alarm to update
KeyValuePair of fields to update

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.AlarmFilter
member.summary: The alarm filter is used when getting alarm lines. This can be used to search specific alarms or list the alarm in different ways. The filter consists of conditions which are the constains that is used getting the alarms. The filter result is the intersection of the defined conditions. On the filter the order can be set which controls the resulting output order of the alarm lines. If multiple orders are applied the priority of the orders are given by position in the array. First position has the highest priority.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.AlarmFilter.ExtensionData
member.summary: Reserved for internal use

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.AlarmFilter.Conditions
member.summary: Conditions of the filter

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.AlarmFilter.Orders
member.summary: Orders of the filter.

member.name: T:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.EventFilter
member.summary: The event filter is used when getting event lines. This can be used to search specific events or list the event in different ways. The filter consists of conditions which are the contains that is used getting the events. The filter result is the intersection of the defined conditions. On the filter the order can be set which controls the resulting output order of the event lines. If multiple orders are applied the priority of the orders are given by position in the array. First position has the highest priority.

member.name: P:VideoOS.Platform.Proxy.Alarm.EventFilter.ExtensionData
